name: Washington Marriott Wardman Park Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awesome time, stayed July 25-30, 2011, staff was very courteous and friendly, rooms were great size and very comfortable. Pub restaurant served great food, at reasonable prices. Property is large, but we had no problems finding our way around. I was able to check my email on computers supplied by the hotel, located in the lobby !. Commuter rail stop adds to convenient travel around the city. My husband and I enjoyed your stay , .... we will be back!!
reviews.title: Hotel is great , we will be back
I decided to not read reviews prior to our stay--so it would be a surprise
reviews.text: Love DC

Our family tagged along with my husband for a business trip to get away from the mountains. He had already made the arrangements based on the fact that he had stayed here before, and that he is not hard to please. I was on tripadvisor looking for a hotel to stay in for one night near the museums in DC when I noticed that this Wardman Park Marriott was eighty- something out of whatever ??? ( If it was 'out of a 1000', it would not have been my first choice, but anything would've been better than home at the time--so I wasn't complaining...which is unusual ) SO ! I decided to not read any reviews, and I have not read any as of yet - which makes this a 'virgin' review if you will...
reviews.title: Highly Recommend, would definitely stay again.

reviews.text: First of all - when you check in, they give you a mini map folder with your room key - hang onto that ; it will probably come in handy...the place is huge! Lots of suits, conventions, people on cell phones -- you get the picture
reviews.title: Good conference hotel

reviews.text: Second ? Our first room smelled weird, had artistic masterpieces on the wall from a previous toddler guest, a toilet that sounded like a jet taking off because the tank cover did not fit properly AND a sticky spot on the floor that was inescapable ( I'm a little more picky than my husband ) I'll get over it ...so I thought
reviews.title: Excellent conference hotel

reviews.text: This location is in a really neat area. The cab ride from the airport took us through the forest primeval...gorgeous parks and creeks, etc. I was there for a conference and didn't sightsee much, but did not the convenience of a nearby metro station (Woodley Park Zoo Metro)
reviews.title: Really cool neighborhood for those who like to be outdoors

reviews.text: This is one of my favorite DC hotels, and recommend staying on concierge floor. Excellent breakfast and evening appetizers. Harry's and the bar in lobby are great. Internet in lobby too slow to be of value. Used the fitness center daily for a week and even though busy, never had to wait for the many many machines.
reviews.title: I love this place....

reviews.text: We stayed in the new tower in a executive suite. First rate all the way. Restaurants at hotel are pricey,but across the street are many other choices. The subway is also across the street.
reviews.title: Great hotel,Great location
Nice hotel, but outside of the "main" DC
reviews.text: My stay at the Wardman Park was very nice. I was in an Executive Suite, which is very large, modern and could easily hold 6-8 person business meetings. Room service was very good and speedy. The hotel is rather large and you could get a bit lost in the meeting space, but after a few days, it becomes easy to navigate. The hotel is located outside of the "main" DC monuments in the Woodley Park area (near the Zoo), but very close to a metro station to take you into town if you want to sightsee. There are a number of varied restaurants just outside of the hotel if you want to venture out.

This sprawling hotel within walking distance of the Zoo, is a favorite DC destination. The lobby is enormous, leading to a large sunlit dining area which offers a bountiful brunch. Inauguration balls are held here, but dogs are allowed and welcome.
reviews.title: Dogs, Babies, Nannies, and Business People, All Welcomed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights here in June as we visited our daughter who lives in the Cleveland Park area. We were greeted warmly by the valet parking staff. We took our car in and out many times during our stay and each time the valet staff was very friendly and attentive. The bellhop who took our luggage to our room was very informative and quickly located another luggage rack for our use. We stayed in the tower and had a very nice room. The room was very comfortable. Our room was quiet and the matress and pillows were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Beautiful location

reviews.text: We used the lobby bar two times while we used the internet. The staff was friendly and attentive. We had a very good breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The grounds were beautifully landscaped. I spent two afternoons reading on the hotel patio. This was very relaxing after hours of touring downtown DC. This is in a great neighborhood with many restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.text: My only fault was the lack of wifi in the room. We had to go to the lobby to use our computer and this was spotty regarding reception. We are reward members but were told the lobby was the only place to use our computer. Otherwise we had a great stay. I fact such a good stay that we booked Marriott on our next destination on this trip, the Canadian side of Niagra Falls.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, so happy the HSUS went back there.

reviews.text: We are only sorry that our daughter is moving to Arlington, VA and we will not have a reason to stay here again.
reviews.title: Definitely stay in the older part of the hotel--amazing room

reviews.text: This charming hotel is DC's largest with 1300 some rooms. There are two sections/parts to the hotel. One is newer and a "typical" hotel room can be found there. The great "secret" is the Wardman Tower which is furnished with antiques and provides a haven from the hustle and bustle of the main hotel and DC hurry.
reviews.title: Huge Hotel, Perfect Location, Great Facilities, Noisy Rooms

reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriott Wardman Park for just one night, but I would definitely go back. The hotel is really beautiful (even impressive, I would say), and really well located, quite close to Dupont Circle (about 20-25 minutes walk). It is also extremely close to a metro station, which makes it really easy to reach. The room was very spacious and clean. The reception efficient and very willing to help. The neighbourhood of the hotel is really nice, with plenty of restaurants and shops, and things to see. Definitely, I'd go back.
reviews.title: A perfect match between elegance and location

reviews.text: We stayed here during the Easter break. The grounds were spectacular with thousands of tulips in bloom. There is a lovely terrace where you can sit and enjoy your morning coffee among the tulips. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. This really nice hotel is perfectly located for exploring Washington. The Subway stop is on the corner and the National Zoo is in walking distance. The surrounding neighborhood features lots of resturants and shops and seems to be safe. Lots of activity on the streets in the evening but not the rowdy kind. This will be our first choice for any future trips to DC
reviews.title: Perfectly located beautiful hotel

reviews.text: This Marriott is in a pretty neighborhood, just outside Washington DC's downtown area. To visit any of the attractions you will need to take a taxi. The grounds are attractive but some of the interior areas are a little dated. This is a large convention hotel and the lobbies and hallways were pretty crowded. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the staff was polite.
reviews.title: Traditional Marriott

reviews.text: Priceline put us at the Mariott Wardman Park. Got a decent deal, so can't complain. But how was the hotel?
reviews.title: good for conferences, so-so for families

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Nothing special - Nothing bad

aka: Washington Marriott Wardman Park Hotel Washington Dc
description: Even among the most sophisticated hotels in Washington, DC, Wardman Park Marriott rises above the rest. With a blend of charm, modern elegance and a historic landmark setting, comfortable guest rooms, extensive event space and experienced staff make our hotel the perfect choice for business and leisure travelers. Situated on 16 garden acres with 1,314 guest rooms including 125 VIP suites, plus an outdoor pool and sundeck, our hotel is the perfect place for vacationers to enjoy their down time. Families will delight in our close proximity to the National Zoo and other top area attractions. With 195,000 sq ft of event space and 95,000 sq ft of exhibit space, meeting and conference planners find Washington Marriott Wardman Park a perfect venue for events of any size. Additionally, the comprehensive conference services and expert staff ensure that every event runs smoothly and flawlessly.
